name: hexagon cardigan with hood
notes:
add pizazz to your wardrobe with this striking crochet cardigan. sweater is created by first making 2 large hexagons and folding them in a clever way to form a basic cardigan. extra rounds and rows are then worked on the sleeves to give it extra length. red heart super saver stripes does all the colorwork for you so you can focus on techniques, including chain, working in the round, double crochet, folding into shape, and more! a cozy hood is added to finish off this fun garment.

materials
red heart® super saver® stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) 
favorite stripe (4965) or retro stripe (4971) or fruity stripe (4962)
xs/s m/l xl/2/3xl 4/5xl 7 7 8 9 balls

gauges
12 single crochet (sc) and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
6 rounds (rnds) in pattern (pat) = 4" [10 cm].

measurements
finished chest
sizes xs/s m/l xl/2/3xl 4/5xl
42" [106.5 cm], 48" [122 cm], 56" [142 cm], 66" [167.5 cm]

models are wearing size m/l in red heart® super saver® stripes™
female model has 34" [96.5 cm] chest and is 5 feet 9 inches tall.

*previously credited to red heart design team*
